website_summaries.verdict: The Klein offers the cleanest cut of any model we considered, along with the most precise stripping and shaping holes. The product is built to last by a trusted tool company.
pros: This model will cut up to 18 AWG solid or 20 AWG stranded wire
Will cut through wire without fraying the ends for easy threading and splicing
Holes for bending, looping, and stripping wire are precisely measured and easy to use
Serrated nose provides a strong grip for pulling loose wires or other small obstacles
Tool is light enough for anyone to use, yet the heavy-duty material is tough enough to stand up to frequent usage
cons: Some users report that blades may need sharpening quickly with frequent usage on the heaviest gauges of soft wire

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this stripper; you'll only have to pay once and she'll keep stripping for a good long time
customer_reviews.text: Great stripper ... I mean, not quite as good as the ones from my college days, but they weren't quite this sharp. I replaced a cheap home depot $10 stripper with this one and the difference is stunning. It cuts wires with a resounding sharp "click" and strips like wires were meant to be naked. Really, a great tool if you're going to be stripping every once in a while - or every day.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels like high quality steel so it should last a long time and maybe even the last one I will have to buy. It strips the insulation without any damage to the wire itself. It locks closed so nothing can damage the cutting edges while inside your tool kit. It has a really good gripping tip that is way to tempting to use as pliers. I feel if I start using it as a multi tool it will not last as long and should only be used as intended (wire strippers).
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Being Klein I expected them to be excellent or at least good but would rate these at ...
customer_reviews.text: I was underwhelmed with these strippers. Being Klein I expected them to be excellent or at least good but would rate these at just being okay mostly because the openings are just a little too big and so that wire jacket doesn't get completely cut and it is hard to pull off requiring some extra twisting and turning. A pair of strippers I got at all places at harbor freight work much better and at a fraction of the cost, unfortunately they don't work for larger size conductors.
customer_reviews.author: Sven Masuro

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT SMALL GAUGE WIRE STRIPPERS
customer_reviews.text: I do wiring for a living. I make cables and I am constantly prepping small wires to solder in tight places. I needed wire strippers that were precise on very small gauges. These are excellent, they don't take any more than they are supposed to. Now my 26 gauge stranded wires don't lose any hairs when I'm stripping off the jacket. Klein tools always have a quality feel, these are top-shelf and highly recommended if you do wiring for a living.
customer_reviews.author: Mark KingTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: nice set
customer_reviews.text: just as expected, good quality from klein. disappointed on the packaging, came in a envelope but not damaged. surprisingly light weight
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Murica!
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, I only use them for homeowners chores. Hey, that’s what I am! But I’m at a point in my life, that even if it’s gonna be an infrequently used tool, I won’t buy crap. Klein is the good stuff. Precision machined. Accurate sizing. Very comfortable handles. Good materials. In a word, Quality. Made in America. Don’t cheap out on tools. Pay a little more and never regret it. Highly recommended. Thanks for reading
customer_reviews.author: MooseTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Nice pliers but the lock was loose
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, except the small lock piece was very loose and it would frequently catch while using the pliers, irritating.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. HoagTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: The only brand of tools for an electrician
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully made pair of wire strippers. Smooth hinge mechanism, comfortable ergonomics, great tactile feel of the rubber grip and super sharp sharp cutting sections. A tool of this quality could only be made in... the USA! Only set I'll need for quite some time. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RickyPetite

customer_reviews.title: Quality Wire Strippers
customer_reviews.text: My Klein wire stripper is good quality and works like a champ. I should have bought these years ago. Satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin E.

customer_reviews.title: Complements my wire stripper for smaller gauges
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed to strip 8 and 10 gauge stranded wire. Well made and from the USA.
customer_reviews.author: CaptPete43

customer_reviews.title: the lock can be very annoying
customer_reviews.text: my review is more based on how I use wire strippers. The product as its described is pretty accurate. My issues is with the lock. Like I said its more on me and how I hold/use them. But as a commercial electrician stripping and trying joints is an all the time thing. My issue was almost every time I stripped the wire my finger would lock the pliers. As you can already see how annoying that would get while trying to work at a good past. I also would say I have medium sized hands. So also could play a role in it. I choose to stick with the smaller yellow handled pair with no lock. Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Dion Rogacki

customer_reviews.title: Wire Strippers
customer_reviews.text: Used on and automotive wiring project and they worked well. Quality made stripping tool that should last years. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few reasonably priced, good quality strippers handling a great range of wire gauges for fine modelling. I’ve wired the better part of a sizable HO layout and several locomotives with just this one stripper. Lasting fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Stylian N. Cocalides

customer_reviews.title: Way better than Nomi Malone!
customer_reviews.text: High quality wire strippers! Had a cheapo pair of wire strippers that used to just snag and shred my wires. This Klein tool has been amazing. I work with a lot of fine 26-30 awg stranded wire, and these do a fantastic job of stripping them without yanking out a bunch of extra strands. Highly recommend these, really awesome build quality and do a great job of stripping!
customer_reviews.author: A Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Wire Cutter and Stripper
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded our home theater system with new speakers, and made my own speaker cables and plugs. The cheap and many years old wire stripper that I had in my toolbox was not up to the task, thus my need to get a capable new tool. This Klein wire stripper is well made and worked perfectly for the heavy 12 AWG speaker cable that I am using.
customer_reviews.author: Phil in Magnolia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wire strippers
customer_reviews.text: These are the old standbys and they work great. The blades are sharp, the steel is good quality, the handles are comfortable to use, the tool itself is fairly light. I have been limping on for years using a razer to strip wires, because all you need is a little blade and your set, but this is *far* better. I prefer this type to the heavier universal strippers, seems easier to control. I purchased this and the larger-gauge cousin (Klein Tools 11055, with the yellow stripe) so I could work with the full range of wire. I always buy US made tools when possible, so I'm satisfied that this will be a worthwhile investment. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY SATISFIED
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly pleased with this excellent Klein tool. I shopped around online for a reasonably priced deal on some high quality wire stripers to use mostly on model railroad projects, and I have not been disappointed in this tool. It is easy to use, and does a good, clean removal of the insulation without getting stuck or damaging the conductors, I had looked at some tools for one-third the price, but I am glad I paid the difference and bought this American-made tool.
customer_reviews.author: David Hersman

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool--works well
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of tools designed to strip insulation from small diameter wire. And over a long period of time (my last one from another maker is at least a dozen years old) performance drops off. While I'm not a particularly heavy user of these small wire strippers (I use them in my hobby when needed) it's irritating when they wear out. It may be because the tool wasn't originally well made, or the cutting edges get dull. I bought this one because reviews said that the cutting edges were very sharp. I've now used it a couple of times and that's true. The stripper appears to be well made--a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Decent, not great, but no other good options out there
customer_reviews.text: Needed to strip large wire (6awg & 8awg) and regular wire strippers won't do that, not doing enough to buy an expensive pair so I get what I paid for. Well enough made, seems like they'll hold up, but don't do a great job stripping as the jaws aren't sized quite precisely enough so you end up taking out a bunch of strands of wire along with the insulation sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Bass

customer_reviews.title: One of the best.
customer_reviews.text: As an electrician I would highly recommend these wire strippers. They’re easy to grip, use and they actually cut 8/32 screws better than I expected! Usually other pliers say they will but then after a few times either fall apart or not cut anymore. These cut them with moderate effort but still get it done. It’s worth the investment, Klein makes good products with good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty good stripper
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good stripper. I started playing with electronics and needed a wire stripper for thin wires. I got this from the Amazon Warehouse and it came in bad exterior shape (Acceptable grade) but was usable. The curved handle is more comfortable than a typical stripper and the action is very smooth. I was able to test out a few wires and it stripped them easily with no problems. Not much more to say except I'm hoping that because it's a Klein, it will last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Just a dad

customer_reviews.title: Don't stay fully closed in "lock" position
customer_reviews.text: Fairly disappointed. I've used channel lock brand strippers for 8 years now, and bought these because of the glow in the dark handles. The Klein strippers do not stay fully closed when you"lock" them. Bought 2 pairs, both are like that. Ended up removing the grips from the Klein and putting them on the channel locks. Also the Klein didn't open as wide as channel lock. If I could, I'd buy only the grips to glue them on the better strippers. Those issues alone were enough that I stopped using the Klein after 30 mins of use. They seemed to strip fine, and cut wire well if you could get it in.
customer_reviews.author: Billy green

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money. Perfect strippers for panel work all day long
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these strippers for about three years now. They are extremely easy on your hands if you are building or upgrading panels all day. They are light, feel good in your hand and last for a long time. In 3 years I've only had to replace them twice.
customer_reviews.author: stephen a.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste $7 on a cheapo. BUY THESE. Don't use razor blades anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste $7 on a cheapo. The reason you use razor blades instead of that Cheapo stripping tool? because that cheapo is not machined to the perfect size for each gauge. Those cheapos have tiny imperfections that grab strands and tear them out. Not these, GOOD MACHINING = CLEAN STRIP. So much better. These changed my outlook on stripping tools. I still carry a curved hook, and straight razor when wiring, but these come with me too now.
customer_reviews.author: diox8tony

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT QUALITY~EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: I got these to strip speaker wire. I have arthritis in my hands, so I need tools to be easy to grip and easy to squeeze, and these are both. I had to put the wire into a hole for a smaller gauge to make them work easily enough for me, but that's OK. They cut through the plastic casing like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Somin

customer_reviews.title: Nice too for only $20! Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: These strippers work very well for stripping fine wire. I use these frequently to strip 28awg and 26awg wire. USA made and only $20. I can't stand junky overseas made tools that cost 40-60% the price of USA made and only 10% the quality. Spend less and get terrible results and likely cause more than $20 worth of damage or waste. BUY USA tools, buy once, save money, and get results you can be satisfied with.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Young

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought two different kinds of wire stripper before getting this one... The other two I threw as far as I could because they were drunk and they made me swear like a mother f***** .....then i ordered these and wow what a difference....these will strip wires like a hot knife in butter. If you are tired of swearing at your no name and no good junk wire strippers then get these ones and you will be amazed
customer_reviews.author: Bas

customer_reviews.title: Made in U.S.A.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality! There is something unique and special about a U.S. made product. One touch and you can tell the robustness and functionality of its design and engineering. Grew up in the Philippines until 1970 (14 yrs old). In those days everything is made in America. My Dad’s Smith and Wesson and Colt 45, was taught how to handle these for self defense. Our cars were Oldsmobile, Buick or Chevy. Appliances: GE, Frigidaire, Zenith and Emerson. In those days made in USA means No. 1, top of the line. Like this tool. I wished everything is still U.S. made. The way I remember it. I love America.
customer_reviews.author: Felix "Bay Area"

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to strip 30awg Kynar. For the most part they do the job pretty well. However, I also bought the Ideal Industries stripper ( and it strips 30awg better. If stripping 30awg is your primary use I would go with the Ideal Industries stripper but overall this is still a great, well built tool.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: High quality tool. I faffed about with other strippers and finally got this set. The difference in quality is immediately noticeable. I just bought another set for smaller gauge wire, as some of the wiring on my motorcycle uses 22ga
customer_reviews.author: Greg Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Great wire stripper
customer_reviews.text: Installed 6AWG wire for a Home EV charger. Didn't want to trust the sidecutters on my pliers for such an important job. These worked VERY well, and easily would be just as flawless on smaller-gauge (thinner) wires. Definitely would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Of all strippers I've used, these win
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing electrical work for 8 years now and have gone through a lot of strippers. These Kleins are the only ones I've come to trust. Southwires are okay, but their middle nut always loosens. Greenlees work fine, but the quality isn't as good as these Kleins. I've used these Kleins for much more rigorous tasks than they are designed for (using them as pliers, knockout punching, etc) and they've always just worked. The only reason I bought this pair I'm reviewing is because I lost the other pair. Gonna stick with these as long as the quality stays high until I die.
customer_reviews.author: punchingbag

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Not what the fluffy reviews made them out to be.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special. Hard to read or guess which side the wire are supposed to feed through. Sometimes it would strip away wire itself from the cut. Nothing special. If I could go back I would not purchase these. To top it off it doesnt even have the blue/yellow/red crimping ability. I would pass if I were you. Dont believe the fluffy praises 5star BS like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Knowledge Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Get these...
customer_reviews.text: Much less frustrating to use. They have long grooves for gripping the insulation, and so far have stayed sharp. Much better than several other brands I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Expedition

customer_reviews.title: Best wire stripper out there
customer_reviews.text: I have used various wire strippers for decades, including the small yellow grip handles where you "set" your own pressure against the insulation. This is the best tool out there for stripping insulation, hands down. Easy to use presets for multiple gauges, an ergonomic no slip grip, at a decent price point. The last wire stripper I expect to buy....whats not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Bill in VA

customer_reviews.title: Built right to work right- clean and fast- cut, strip, bend & pull
customer_reviews.text: I have many Klein tools, but sometimes try other brands because Klein is expensive. Once again, I made the mistake of buying a highly-rated, slightly less expensive tool that was supposed to be comparable. Had to return it. Back to Klein it is. Just buy Klein. Every part of this tool works perfectly and I have zero complaints. Strip, cut, bend and pull. Does it right the 1st time and doesn't fail for ages.
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: As for performance, works flawlessly. Great tool. One thing preventing it from being a five star is when I received it, it was in a generic bubble envelope. This is fine. But the actual tool looked very dirty; not because it was used or anything but as if the grease/oil on the metal to prevent from rusting had completely dried out and caked.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pak

customer_reviews.title: Quality made, easily cuts and strips.
customer_reviews.text: I had heard of the quality behind Klein tools. To finally own one I see what all the talk is about. Far better made than the cheap $10 hardware store strippers. Rather buy a quality set that cost 2x more but will work better and probably last 2-3x longer. Nice padded handle. Spring tension in the handle is just right.
customer_reviews.author: SAMIAM

customer_reviews.title: Get them, use them, they will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.text: OK, so there is a reason that you will see a set of Klein wire strippers in almost every single tool bag of any electrician across almost every profession. They are spectacular tools and perform as expected. It almost seems pointless posting a review for these but, in case you are on the fence, get off of it and buy these. You will NOT be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Soundaround

customer_reviews.title: Really good stripper/cutter
customer_reviews.text: This tool effortlessly strips wires without damaging the conductor—which, of course, is the whole point. The jaw apertures are clearly labeled for both solid and stranded wire gauges (printed on the obverse side and stamped on the reverse side), the tool is comfortable to use, and the handle lock is very conveniently placed to allow the tool to be locked or unlocked with a swipe of the thumb. I was pleased enough to buy another for a different range of wire gauges.
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I am an electronic engineering technician, retired. I strip 30 ga. Kynar and Teflon wire for many of my hobby electronics. Finally I have found wire strippers that do the job better than any other strippers I have. A very well made product worth the price, and made in the U.S. as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt A. Pochert

customer_reviews.title: I like the lock in closed position better on the new ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an older pair of Klein 1105. I like the lock in closed position better on the new strippper - it functions better. The new design uses a rivet in the pivot joint while the older strippers have a hex head fastener at the pivot joint allowing me to tighten the action when it became loose. The old strippers have engraved wire sizes on both sides of the blades - the new pair have engraved numbers on one side and the other side is surface printed. The printed side is much easier to read. Time will tell how well it wears. Still made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KLINE WIRE CUTTER/STRIPPER - EXCELLENT, FEELS GOOD IN THE HAND
customer_reviews.text: I have used these little so far, but more projects are upcoming. EVERY Kline tool I have ever had has performed flawlessly, and that includes the wire cutter/stripper. I was working with some very fine wire and the stripper simply worked. You can buy cheaper tools, but you cannot do much better than Kline, period.
customer_reviews.author: rogerc

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: These Klein strippers are just fabulous. Super sharp and they make a precision cut, every time. A bit more expensive than a Chinese tool, but having the insulation strip right off without even knicking the wire inside makes them worth the money. I'm usually a cheapskate with tools, but this time, no regrets about spending a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Coronet BlueTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Sweet precise pleasure to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm definitely an amateur, occasional user - this tool is such a major upgrade from the wire tools I've had in the past from kits or whatever. This thing is a pleasure to use. Everything it does is smooth and precise. I'm halfa55 thinking up a little wiring project just to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Better than an auto stripper
customer_reviews.text: I had been using an automatic stripper for years. It was fast but started taking chunks out of the wires which became a problem when I was tapping existing wires in a house. This stripper is a bit pricier but works perfectly every time for 12 and 14 gauge wires common in household wiring. No accidental damage to the conductors.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E

customer_reviews.title: i like klein's strippers like these and they are affordable
customer_reviews.text: i have all the klein curve models now. i wish i had gotten this one months ago instead of the 8g max version, but i don't think this one existed when i got that one. i like klein's strippers like these and they are affordable. i also use knipex and lindstrom pliers, but they tend to be a bit more pricey. the kleins have always been a go-to brand, and these fit my hands and processes well. i have not tried the ones that look similar from greenlee or southwire, and though they are cheaper, i likely won't.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Low quality/bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, I see some scratches almost like it was used already, and the two halves don't line up perfectly, so when I squeeze it shut, they scrape together. Overall it seems poorly made and I'm not sure it would last long if someone used it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Arrived used or it was a return. It has dirty smudges and wasn't in any packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to using this to replace lost ones. But, wasn't thrilled with its condition upon arrival as paid for what we thought was new. Not sure if you can see the brown smudges in the photo. But, it will work. Nothing wrong with what matters and it will get dirty anyway.
customer_reviews.author: C. Denham

customer_reviews.title: Comes in handy
customer_reviews.text: I do alot of #6,8 wire at work, and usually would use a knife but my wife got me this from the queue for christmas. It gets through the bigger wire well, and still goes down to a 12 awg as well. I wouldn't call it a must have, but if you dont mind carrying a second pair of strippers they come in handy on the bigger stuff.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Best stripper out there
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd purchase of this item. My first was stolen. Otherwise I don’t think that I would have ever needed to buy this again. There is no better American pliers/strippers than Klein. Still Made in the USA! For professions or homeowners who want the best. These are the best wire strippers available, period. They give you the most common gauges to strip and stays sharp for years. (Didn’t sharpen the last pair for 5 years.) The grip is ergonomic and reduces chance of electrocution. (Non-insulated but still rubber.)
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: They still work the best for me.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a pair of these for about 25 years now. I liked them when I was a kid and that was the main reason I ordered a pair of my own. They are a good set of strippers/cutters/plyers/screw breakers. These things are great if you know how to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Glen 2021

customer_reviews.title: It's rated this high for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a wire stripper and cutter to replace outlets around the house, and this tool is perfect for the job. I got the 10-18 AWG Solid, 12-20 AWG Stranded version, and it fit my needs perfectly. Stripping and cutting wires was a breeze, much easier than scoring a wire with an exacto knife and trying to get a precise cut.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love the Glow in the Dark!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I love all Klein tools but these are especially awesome because they are glow in the dark! I sometimes have to work when it's dusk and even dark so it makes it nice and easy to find in my bag of tools! They are bright, really bright! The grip is also very soft and comfortable in the hand. If your looking for a good pair of wire strippers these are a great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Buy the best wire strippers...why not?
customer_reviews.text: These are the best wire strippers out there, IMO. They are made in the USA, and may cost a bit more; but you certainly get what you pay for. They are ergonomic; and are very comfortable. I have two different versions for various size wire...and couldn't be happier... You won't be disappointed with Klein tools, IMO. I recommend these to the do-it-yourself person (like me) or to the professional lineman...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need
customer_reviews.text: As a PV Installer for Tesla, I cut a ton of wire all day everyday, so I need a solid pair of strippers to do the job. I have used all kinds of other brands and these Klein strippers are my go to. They will dull overtime but will hold up longer than any other brand I have used. I order from amazon because they cost too much anywhere else. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Smp

customer_reviews.title: The curved grip is comfortable and easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: Made in Amuurica. High quality tool. I've even had a few survive cutting a live circuit! Although they did lose a little bit of their edge. The size is just right to provide enough leverage to cut through any wire that will fit inside the jaws, and the teeth remove insulation perfectly. The curved grip is comfortable and easy to hold, and the latch operation is very easy and smooth which makes taking the cutter in and out of pocket smooth like butter. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Klein Strippers Solid
customer_reviews.text: I'm an electrician and I swear by these guys, Klein made a simple stipper with a locking mechanism so it doesn't spring open when you throw it in your pocket. Just make sure you buy the ones with the right size for the right job. I have 3 different ones for different size wire, so smaller 18 ga wire for controls, or these my daily beaters for standard wire size 12 and 10 ga I use these guys.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: 22-32 Works great for tiny wires
customer_reviews.text: Great strippers for tiny headphone wires and small hobby projects. Very happy with my purchase! I was using xacto blades to strip tiny jackets but I'd always cut a few strands off. This helps prevent that with precision tooling, no more cut strands as long as you set the wire in and twist it correctly. These have such high reviews for a reason, they're good.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 32 AWG stranded wire strippers.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 76 and have owned just about every brand and off brand of strippers out there for over 60 years. I have been in need of very good strippers of 32 AWG stranded wire. These strippers do a great job of cutting away the insulation but not nicking the very fine strands of wire. I highly recommend these strippers. Klein Tools are still great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived used.. A lack of quality control or none at all
customer_reviews.text: I got my item this morning like it was suppose too. The issue i have is the pliers appear to be used and Dirty.... I did not buy them used nor did i pay a special price for it. Quality control is lacking i am really disappointed in Klein it used to be my go to brand for any tools for working on electrical. I am a retro fitter so i use my tools everyday. I guess i will go back to over paying off the Snap On tool truck again at least i know i am buying a new tool every time.Again its disappointing Klein 😒
customer_reviews.author: John Gascon

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I decided I needed a pair of these, just in case I had a need for them. Well, the very next day at work, my boss asked me for some wire strippers that stripped 22 awg and I was very happy to hand him my new wire strippers. The first thing he did was cut some 22/6 wire from the box and immediately said, "those are sharp." I smiled and told him that I just got them in the mail yesterday. I ended up using them the whole day and I kept reminding myself that I needed to buy more products from Klein. I really like Greenlee products as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: May or may not be new tool.
customer_reviews.text: Love Klien tools but really disappointed in this particular purchase. Tool came without any retail packaging in a white bubble tape envelope with some kind of ripped/chewed up promo flyer and the set looks like it's been sitting in someone's toolbox already. I bough the grey handle with red accent curves a week ago and have been using them extensively and they are cleaner and in better condition than these. Just wanted these for the spring open feature. Dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good strippers
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my 4th or 5th set of these specific klein strippers. I used them daily and really prefer this design over other strippers I've tried. They stay sharp for a good amount of time and the 6-32 & 8-32 screw cutters definitely come in handy. Just thought it was weird they did not come in the original packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Herbie Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Klein on the decline
customer_reviews.text: Klein Tools were the bench mark of quality hand tools but not anymore. The pliers I got would not severe the strands of copper in a 12ga wire. Its really disappointing since my mentors, in my apprenticeship days all swore by Klein Tools . There was a time when old school American products meant excellence , Klein is becoming an example of that decline.
customer_reviews.author: Jungle King

customer_reviews.title: Great for small wires....
customer_reviews.text: This wire stripper works great for small wires. It was a little more pricey than I'd have liked. In retrospect, the cheaper equivalent at Harbor Freight may have been adequate for my needs. However, if you're frequently stripping small gauge wire, you may appreciate this tool. I've used other Klein tools, and they are top quality.
customer_reviews.author: Spumanti

customer_reviews.title: but I'm tooling up my garage a little better and had an upcoming radio install to do so ...
customer_reviews.text: I have some cheaper wire strippers, but I'm tooling up my garage a little better and had an upcoming radio install to do so I thought I'd get a better pair of strippers. These saved me a lot of frustration as stripping the wires was almost effortless compared to the cheaper strippers I have. They seem to be made for awful small wire, but they worked fine for me with some wire a little bigger. When cutting the insulation, you can feel the point that the cut is made and then simply strip off, leaving the wiring underneath perfect. They are a great addition to my garage
customer_reviews.author: Travis798

customer_reviews.title: ... gauge holes are not accurate and the cutters are dull after one month I have been in the trades ...
customer_reviews.text: The gauge holes are not accurate and the cutters are dull after one month I have been in the trades for 25 years and am disappointed in quality of this tool even tho Klein is usually the best
customer_reviews.author: HMH

customer_reviews.title: Great wire stripper
customer_reviews.text: Klein tools are great, this is no exception. Comfortable to hold and high quality construction.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: They're kleins
customer_reviews.text: Solid wire strippers. These were my first proper pair and it's such an improvement over the cheap adjustable strippers. The time saved pays for them tenfold and they're very solidly made. Lock is good and handle is comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Klein makes some of the finest hand tools available!
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about it! Accurate strips without nicking the wire within the insulation. I purchased two tools to be able to handle all the sizes that I am likely to encounter.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sky

customer_reviews.title: Another great Klein Tools product
customer_reviews.text: I install mobile radios, so I splice and terminate a lot of automotive power leads. In that, I work with several different wire gauges. These stripper/cutters hold an edge well providing clean and reliable stripping and they have a smooth & solid action. Leagues above your run of the mill low-dollar crimper cutters.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: These are the best wire stripper/cutters
customer_reviews.text: All you need is these and a utility knife for 95% of all your typical household electrical work on 12 and 14g wiring, which is 95% of the wiring in your home. These are by far the most comfortable and well made set made. Can’t go wrong with Klein tools!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, easy to use, nice locking mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here. I bought this to strip 28g wire for making my own USB cables. I was able to strip both the outer shell and the wires themselves without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Very good wirestrippers for work or around the house
customer_reviews.text: Overall good wire stripper and many people at my job have these and like them. Always impressed with Klein products. Only dislike is I wish the cutter part was a little sharper but still works good
customer_reviews.author: Dash Bierman

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a decent wire cutter, novice hobby purposes for copper wire. I'm glad I went with this set as it has cut very well. The glow in the dark is neat too.
customer_reviews.author: Hello People!

customer_reviews.title: Cuts certain material
customer_reviews.text: Don’t try to cut any other metal besides copper wires. The screw cutter slots are really useful for situations where you need to shortened the size of a screw.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This tool allows you to do everything you need to cut, strip and bend wire for electrical connection and is very nice to hold. Well worth the money for an all in one tool.
customer_reviews.author: John R. King

customer_reviews.title: Great to strip wires
customer_reviews.text: They are really great to strip wires and fit comfortable in your hand . I would definitely recommend to anyone who needs some, these work great .
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Moreno

customer_reviews.title: cutter hes made not so Accurately, WILL BE BETTER : 10-12 to 20-22 awg
customer_reviews.text: very good product, but cutter hes made not so Accurately, two blades not Touching each other with 100 percent, and for 5 star this stripper not be 10-12 to 18- 20 awg,,, WILL BE BETTER : 10-12 to 20-22 awg, at car works, need to be 22 awg, i use this time another stripper, and this is Shame for brand klein
customer_reviews.author: giorgi

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I am a fairly bug DIY guy. I actually only got these because one of my favorite youtube DIY guys always has these. Maybe it's product placement, I don't know, but I decided to order them and they make my old wire strippers look like ancient tools. They feel great. I love the texture rubber grip and the way it feels in my hand just feels like a premium product to add to my tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Topping

customer_reviews.title: What a Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, very precisely machined and manufactured to last. The stripping dies are just right so they don't nick and weaken the copper but easily strip away the insulation. Wish I would have bought one of these 40 years ago. I'd still have it and would bet it's still working fine.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with Klein
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set of strippers, recently I have found myself stripping a boat load of 6 awg and 8awg, and I was using my standard Klein kurve strippers, and quickly realized that I had to get a pair that was actually meant for these sizes. And for what I paid for them you couldn’t ask for a better deal in my eyes. A lot of guys I work with have the southwire equivalents and I did a side by side comparison and I’ll go with the Klein’s day after day
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Glow in the Dark
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these for work. These pliers literally illuminate a dark space when they are charged up. They work great. They do the job. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: The.VerdictTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: I like the shape
customer_reviews.text: All of the hand tools in my electrical bag are Knipex, and it's a big heavy bag. EXCEPT that I have a pair of these particular Klein stripper/cutters in there as well. I like the shape, size and feel of these cutters. They do 80% of what needs to be done in commercial/residential wiring and electrical repairs and installations. Are my Knipex Stripper/cutters better? Yes, but I like the compact feel of these Kleins for wiring switches and receptacles.
customer_reviews.author: Builder9

customer_reviews.title: SUPBERB KLEIN INSULATION STRIPPING TOOL
customer_reviews.text: This is a KLEIN brand insulation stripping tool. Every aspect of this transaction was excellent and I would highly recommend this brand, model and vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D PLACAK

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: Received the first pair and the lock wouldn't hold the strippers all the way shut. Reordered a second set to give them another shot....no luck same way. They cut and strip wire just fine but when I reach into my bag to get them out and there is a screwdriver in the gap that is caused by the faulty so called lock it doesn't make me a happy camper
customer_reviews.author: Travis H

customer_reviews.title: You can’t beat Klein
customer_reviews.text: I love this wire stripper. It’s the best. This is my 3rd one to buy in 10 years. And the other two are just fine. I use mine daily and the only thing that is wrong is the locking clasp always breaks off. Other than that, the other problems were my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set of strippers from a name I trust
customer_reviews.text: Klein Tools took care of me when I was a young electrician's apprentice, and they take care of me now for all my electrical/ automotive projects.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is easy to handle. The only negative is the handle lock sometimes engages when I use them. I am a low voltage tech so I will see how long they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3xs
customer_reviews.text: I'm a sucker for a gimmick. The glow in the dark doesnt last for very long, but it lasts long enough. And...put them away because people will steal them...jerks.
customer_reviews.author: AgnusR

customer_reviews.title: Not the cheapest strippers, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Nice build. Klein is the standard for electrician tool sets and these are a perfect stripper for anyone's bag. While not expensive, you can get the job done with a cheaper pair. These will last a while and feel good during use.
customer_reviews.author: Gillespie Photography

customer_reviews.title: Made in  the USA TOOL
customer_reviews.text: Built in the USA for the Trade. I use these everyday, The are great at stripping solid and stranded wire. We strip 12awg and 14awg wiring up equipment. The Cutter cut thru no problem and stripes out the insulation the first time. We have other strippers in our tool box but I always pick these.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Aiello

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: Must have for SERIOUS Electricians and HVAC Technicians! I love my Kleins and wouldn't trade them for nothing! Also insulated so you can use with live wires if you are careful!
customer_reviews.author: adam gibbons

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN THE USA
customer_reviews.text: SUPPORT YOUR FELLOW CITIZEN, THESE WERE 6$ MORE THAN SOME CHINESE CRAP... ALWAYS BUY THE SLIGHTLY MORE EXPENSIVE WAY BETTER USA MADE TOOLS. USA TRUMP 2020
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: kline tools are quality
customer_reviews.text: I am a mechanic and purchased these just so I could strip 22g wire as my current wire strippers could not. while I have not used them on smaller wire than 22g, every strip I have done has taken off the insulation perfectly and not damaged any of the delicate wire.
customer_reviews.author: j.armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Works great, nice alignment, ergonomic grip
customer_reviews.text: I restore vintage motorcycles and make my own wiring looms. My old stripper got lost, so I bought this one. This does what it should do and feels good in the hand. It seems that it should last a long time with low to medium use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Greg E. Covey

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart, and very dull
customer_reviews.text: The handle covers are junk?! They fell apart the first week I used them. The strippers are very dull so its very difficult to strip wire! I am VERY disappointed in Klein, I always thought they made the best especially for electrical. I was wrong!
customer_reviews.author: clarence michael loftis

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several cheap strippers. But these are a big step up. Sharp. Accurate. Easy to use. Spend the money and get a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: El Topo

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent wire strippers, very happy with them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I had some 30awg wire with soft silicone insulation. The wires are very thin and I'm used to the cheapo wire strippers that only manage rip off the insulation (rather than cut and and strip) and usually take a few of the copper strands with it. Anyhow, my cheapo wire strippers don't do 30 awg wire so I figured I'd look for a pair that does. I used them last night to strip several lengths of that silicone wire and it stripped them perfectly, so I'm thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

product_meta.title: Klein Tools 11055 Wire Cutter and Wire Stripper, Stranded Wire Cutter, Solid Wire Cutter, Cuts Copper Wire
product_meta.description:
Style:Klein-Kurve| Size:10 - 18 AWG Solid, 12 - 20 AWG StrandedThis compact, lightweight wire stripper and cutter cleanly cuts solid and stranded copper wire. Strong-gripping serrated nose for easy bending, shaping, and pulling of wire. Handles are double-dipped for comfortable grip. Curved handles help reach into confined areas. Easy-to-read markings on both sides. Wire looping and bending holes. Coil spring provides fast self-opening action. Double-dipped comfort grips with curved handles. Coil spring provides fast self-opening action. Easy-to-read markings. Handy closure lock for convenient storage. Made in USA. For more than 160 years, Klein Tools has manufactured premium-quality, professional-grade hand tools that deliver the performance, durability and precision needed to get the job done right. Our family of engineers, workers and craftsman continue to put six generations of expertise into every tool we create by using only the highest quality materials, superior workmanship, and keeping manufacturing as close to home as we can. Klein isn't just the name of our company, it's also our family name. And since we're an American company that's family-owned and family-run, you know you can count on us to be here tomorrow. Klein Tools doesn't just make great products, we make great products that stand up to the demands of the professionals who use them every day ... Since 1857.

AMAZON.COM
The Klein Tools Klein-Kurve Wire Stripper and Cutter handles 10-18 AWG Solid Wire and 12-20 AWG Stranded Wire. === It features wire looping and bending holes, a strong-gripping serrated nose to easily shape or pull wire, and a closure lock for easy storage. === A coil spring lets you quickly open this tool, and the curved handles with double-dipped comfort grips give you the flexibility to reach tight areas.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Klein Tools 11055 Klein-Kurve Wire Stripper and Cutter handles 10-18 AWG Solid Wire and 12-20 AWG Stranded Wire. It features wire looping and bending holes, a strong-gripping serrated nose to easily shape or pull wire, and a closure lock for easy storage. A coil spring lets you quickly open this tool, and the curved handles with double-dipped comfort grips give you the flexibility to reach tight areas.

See more
feature_bullets: Cuts, strips and loops 10-18 AWG Solid and 12-20 AWG Stranded wire
Strong-gripping serrated nose for easy bending, shaping, and pulling of wire
Holes for looping and bending wire

specifications.Warranty Description: Klein products, manufactured and sold for commercial or industrial uses, are warranted to be free from defects in materials and workmanship for the normal life of the product.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,433 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
